greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ON cells in the even-rule cellular automaton after n steps with the Moore neighborhood (8 neighbors), with minimal nontrivial symmetric initial state (0,0), (0,1), (1,0), and (1,1) ON.
comment: The rule turns a cell to ON at step n if an even, nonzero number of its eight neighbors were ON in the previous. For example, at n=2 the cell (0,0) is ON because the two neighbors (-1,0) and (0,-1) and no others were ON at the previous step.
It appears that whenever n is divisible by 3, there is a visible disjoint 2x2 square leading the automaton in each cardinal direction.
link: Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
example: For n=3, the configuration includes the initial four ON cells plus four other 2 X 2 squares in each cardinal direction.
mathematica: Table[Plus @@ Plus @@ A[[i, All, All]], {i, 1, m}]
results.author: _Kellen Myers_, Feb 06 2015
